original: Unsecured Wi-Fi networks, such as those commonly found in coffee shops or hotels, pose significant security risks. Users connecting to these networks may inadvertently expose their personal information to malicious actors. Additionally, weak passwords further compromise security. Commonly used passwords, such as those based on personal information (e.g., names, birthdates) or simple sequences (e.g., "1234"), are easily guessable and sho
